div.class: inner col col24 first last id982c6eb9-62ab-4dac-b0d9-09e3f06f882d

li.p: Stay up to date with Telluride

div.class: inner col col24 first last id4e26a26d-9235-4f6c-ab37-098d47255dcb

h4.a: Town Council Appoints Zoe Dohnal as Town Manager

div.div: (August 19, 2024) â€“ During todayâ€™s special meeting, Telluride Town Council appointed Zoe Dohnal as the Town of Tellurideâ€™s new town manager, effective tomorrow, Tuesday, August 20. Dohnal was selected during a national search process led by Columbia ltd. Read on...

h4.a: Public Works to Clean and Inspect Main Sewer Line

div.div: (August 17, 2024) â€“ Beginning Monday, August 19, the Public Works Department and its contractor, Southwest Systems, will jet clean and inspect the main sewer line from the Town of Telluride to the Telluride Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant (TRWWTP). Read on...

h4.a: Marshalâ€™s Department Responds to Report of Resident in Crisis

div.div: (August 6, 2024) â€“ The Marshalâ€™s Department responded to a referenced attempted suicide on Colorado Ave this evening around 6:10 pm MT. Employees from a nearby business reacted quickly; the individual is recovering and receiving appropriate care. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Town Council Announces Four Finalists for Role of Town Manager

div.div: (July 30, 2024) â€“ Telluride, CO --- The Telluride Town Council has narrowed their search for a new Town Manager to four finalists. Listed alphabetically by last name, the finalists are Chris Castillian, Silas Clarke, Zoe Dohnal, and Craig Howard. Read on...

h4.a: Marshalâ€™s Department Seeking Information Related to Report of Unlawful Sexual Contact

div.div: (July 30, 2024) â€“ The Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department is actively investigating a report of unlawful sexual contact that occurred near the intersection of West Colorado Avenue and South Davis Street on Monday, July 22, around 10:00 pm MT. Read on...

h4.a: Housing Needs Assessment Community Survey Available Online

div.div: (July 29, 2024) â€“ San Miguel County, CO --- The Regional Housing Needs Assessment Community Survey is now available online for all San Miguel County residents and employees. Read on...

h4.a: Voodoo Rental Housing Lottery Applications Available Wednesday, July 24

div.div: (July 22, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride is conducting a rental housing lottery for the Voodoo Affordable Housing Project at 151 S Willow. The lottery application and materials will be available in English and Spanish by noon on Wednesday, July 24. Read on...

h4.a: Town of Telluride Opens Green Grant Pre-Applications

div.div: (July 19, 2024) â€“ The Town, in partnership with EcoAction Partners, is now accepting pre-applications for Green Grants. This program supports businesses and residents in reducing their carbon footprints to help meet the goals of the Climate Action Plan. Read on...

h4.a: Housing Needs Assessment Community Survey Mailed

div.div: (July 19, 2024) â€“ San Miguel County, CO --- The Towns of Mountain Village and Telluride, and San Miguel County are working with the San Miguel Regional Housing Authority (SMRHA) to conduct a Regional Housing Needs Assessment. Read on...

h4.a: Mayor Finds No Grounds for Disqualification in Housing Authority Commissioner Complaint

div.div: (July 2, 2024) â€“ The Mayor of the Town of Telluride, Teddy Errico, has issued a formal decision regarding an ethics complaint filed against Telluride Housing Authority (THA) Commissioner Dan Enright. Read on...

h4.a: Town of Telluride Announces Schedule & Lineup for Second Annual 4th of July Bash

div.div: (June 28, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride will host the 2nd Annual Fourth of July Bash on Thursday, July 4, 2024, with the help of the Symbiotic Events and the Telluride Fire Protection District and Volunteer Fire Department. Read on...

h4.a: Zoe Dohnal Appointed by Town Council as Acting Town Manager

div.div: (June 25, 2024) â€“ Deputy Town Manager Zoe Dohnal has been named acting town manager for the Town of Telluride with a unanimous 7-0 Town Council vote during todayâ€™s Tuesday, June 25 Regular Meeting. Read on...

h4.a: Short-Term Rental Software Rentalscape to Launch

div.div: (June 24, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride will launch its new software, Rentalscape, to administer and monitor short-term rental (STR) applications, licensing, tax remittance, tracking, and management on Wednesday, June 26, 2024. Read on...

h4.a: Town Seeks Qualified Entities to Lease Voodoo Commercial Space

div.div: (June 7, 2024) - During this weekâ€™s Town Council meeting, a draft RFP was approved with minor changes by Council for issuance today. The Town is seeking proposals from entities interested in the commercial space in the Voodoo Affordable Housing Project. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Honors the Past and Looks to the Future with New Visual Identity

div.div: (May 31, 2024) â€“ To better unify town departments and functions, the Town of Telluride has launched a new visual identity, including a new logo and branding elements. Read on...

h4.a: Street Pothole Patching Operations Commence Throughout Town

div.div: (May 28, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride Public Works Department will begin patching severe potholes throughout town today, Tuesday, May 28. This first round of repairs will include streets with deep potholes that need immediate attention. Read on...

h4.a: Town Council Initiates Nationwide Search for New Town Manager

div.div: (May 23, 2024) â€“ Town Council has voted unanimously in favor of initiating a nationwide search for a new Town Manager with the help of Columbia Ltd. The decision follows the formal resignation of Town Manager Scott Robson, effective Tuesday, June 25. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Valley Floor Work Continues

div.div: (May 22, 2024) â€“ The Grand Mesa, Uncompahgre and Gunnison (GMUG) National Forests, in partnership with Trout Unlimited (TU), announced that reconstruction work will begin mid-June at the Telluride Valley Floor site (Site) in San Miguel County, Colorado. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Barricade Passes Available Through Wednesday, June 19

div.div: (May 22, 2024) â€“ Parks & Recreation will distribute two 2024 Town of Telluride Barricade Passes to all residential property owners through direct mail. A barricade will be set up from Wednesday, June 19, at 4 pm through Sunday, June 23, at midnight. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Parks & Recreation Announce New Warming Hut & Washstand Facility

div.div: (May 17, 2024) â€“ The Parks and Recreation Commission and Staff have initiated the design and construction of a new Warming Hut & Washstand facility in Town Park. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Town Manager Scott Robson Announces Resignation Effective Tuesday, June 25

div.div: (May 14, 2024) â€“ The Town Manager of the Town of Telluride, Scott Robson, has formally announced his resignation from the appointed position. Today, Town Council met to discuss the next steps and formulate a plan for recruiting a new Town Manager. Read on...

h4.a: Design Guidelines and Standards Code Amendment Review Begins

div.div: (May 3, 2024)â€” As part of Town Council's 2024 Goals and Objectives, the Town of Telluride Historic Preservation Department initiated a review of the Design Guidelines and Standards for Building in Telluride in September 2023. Read on...

h4.a: Voodoo Commercial Space Walkthrough and Forum Monday, May 6

div.div: (May 2, 2024) - Town of Telluride staff will introduce a discussion regarding the commercial space at the Voodoo Affordable Housing Project at the regular meeting on Tuesday, May 14. The Town will host a public forum on Monday, May 6, at 9 a.m. Read on...

h4.a: Gold Run Unit, Entrada N Housing Lottery Applications Available Wednesday, May 1

div.div: (April 30, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride and the San Miguel Regional Housing Authority (SMRHA) are conducting a deed-restricted housing ownership lottery for Gold Run Unit B at 1000 E. Colorado Avenue and Entrada Unit N at 295 Mahoney Drive. Read on...

h4.a: Off-Season Paving and Striping Operations to Commence Throughout Town

div.div: (April 28, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride will begin milling, patching, and reconstruction operations on several streets throughout town starting Monday, April 29. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department Investigates Local Teacher for Possession of Child Pornography

div.div: (March 20, 2024) â€“ The Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department received information from the ICAC indicating that local teacher Brandon Baker was in possession of Child Sexual Assault Material (CSAM), commonly referred to as child pornography. Read on...

h4.a: Multiple Vandalism Incidents on Town Marshal Vehicles in the Last Week

div.div: (September 21, 2023) â€“ Local law enforcement has taken Andrew Michael Kjelland into custody after he voluntarily turned himself in to the San Miguel County Sheriffâ€™s Office. Kjelland was the subject of an arrest warrant for menacing issued on Wednesday. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Town Park Campground Reservations Open April 1 for Bookings from May 10 through June 14

div.div: (March 25, 2023) â€“ Parks & Recreation will release the first of four rounds of online campground reservation windows on Monday, April 1 at 9 am MST. The first round of online bookings released will be for reservations beginning May 10 through June 14. Read on...

h4.a: Ecology Commission to Host Forum on Plastics Reduction Ordinance

div.div: (March 21, 2024) â€“ In November 2022, the Town of Telluride adopted the Prohibition and Ban on the Use and Sale of Certain Plastic Materials or Products Ordinance to further discourage the use of single-use plastics. Read on...

h4.a: Chair 7/Carhenge Neighborhood Planning Meetings Scheduled

div.div: (March 5, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride and Telluride Ski & Golf (TSG) are hosting two meetings to discuss a collaborative initiative between the two organizations to plan for base area developments near Chair 7 and the Carhenge Parking Lot. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Housing Authority Formalizes Town Rental Housing Nonrenewal Appeal Process

div.div: (February 22, 2024) â€“ At the last meeting of the Telluride Housing Authority Subcommittee, staff was directed to expedite the development of an appeals process for residents living in Town rental housing who receive a notice of nonrenewal. Read on...

h4.a: Town of Telluride to Host a Collective Envisioning Workshop

div.div: (January 9, 2024) â€“ The Town of Telluride will host a bilingual community workshop to gather valuable feedback from residents to enhance & improve local services. The workshop will provide an open forum for community members to learn about Town services. Read on...

h4.a: Telluride Public Works Announces New Snow Removal Notifications

div.div: (December 28, 2023) â€“ The Public Works Department has begun regular winter operations including snow removal, a major responsibility and focus for the department. The Town has launched text notifications for plowing and snow removal operations. Read on...

h4.a: San Miguel County, Town of Telluride Respond to Offer on Diamond Ridge Property

div.div: (December 20, 2023) â€“ The Managers of San Miguel County and the Town of Telluride responded to parties that recently submitted an unsolicited offer on the 105-acre Diamond Ridge parcel, jointly owned by San Miguel County and the Town of Telluride. Read on...

h4.a: Veterinarians Warn of Severe Upper Respiratory Infection Affecting Dogs

div.div: (December 7, 2023) â€“ The Town of Telluride, Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department, and the Animal Hospital of Telluride join Colorado State University (CSU) Veterinarians in warning of a severe upper respiratory infection affecting dogs. Read on...

h4.a: Town Council Approves First Reading of Monthly Water & Wastewater Billing Cycle

div.div: (November 29, 2023) â€“ Town Council has approved the first reading of an ordinance changing the water and wastewater billing cycle to monthly beginning in 2024. Council also approved the first reading of an ordinance increasing water and wastewater rates. Read on...

img.alt: Telluride Marshals Department Staff Honored with Prestigious Awards for Exceptional Service

h4.a: Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department Staff Honored with Prestigious Awards for Exceptional Service

div.div: (November 20, 2023) â€“ The Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department held an award ceremony last week with MVPD to honor and recognize their service men and women and their community partners for their outstanding service and commitment to public safety. Read on...

img.alt: State Grant for Diamond Ridge Housing Initiative Expires Due to Litigation Delays

h4.a: State Grant for Diamond Ridge Housing Initiative Expires Due to Litigation Delays

div.div: (November 17, 2023) â€“ Due to months of delays caused by litigation against the Diamond Ridge project, DOLA officials need to reallocate the $5 million grant funds to other affordable housing projects around Colorado that are ready to proceed. Read on...

img.alt: Teddy Errico Elected to Serve as Mayor of the Town of Telluride

h4.a: Teddy Errico Elected to Serve as Mayor of the Town of Telluride

div.div: (November 16, 2023) â€“ With a final ballot count occurring this morning, the Town of Telluride has elected Teddy Errico as Mayor for a four-year term. Errico led by 10 points after the final count, with 496 votes of 1,113 votes cast. Read on...

img.alt: San Miguel Regional Housing Authority to Conduct Biennial Compliance Checks

h4.a: San Miguel Regional Housing Authority to Conduct Biennial Compliance Checks

div.div: (November 15, 2023) â€“ On behalf of the Town and the Telluride Housing Authority, San Miguel Regional Housing Authority (SMRHA) will conduct biennial compliance checks for Town of Telluride deed-restricted owners beginning Wednesday, November 29. Read on...

img.alt: Town of Telluride to Host a State-Approved Alcohol Beverage Training

h4.a: Town of Telluride to Host a State-Approved Alcohol Beverage Training

div.div: (November 15, 2023) â€“ The Town of Telluride will host a state-approved responsible vendor training with Alcohol Beverage Trainingâ€™s Brian Turner on Monday, December 4, from 11:30 am to 3:30 pm at Rebekah Hall. Read on...

img.alt: Mayoral Race Too Close to Call, Ashley Story and Elena Levin to serve on Telluride Town Council

h4.a: Mayoral Race Too Close to Call, Ashley Story and Elena Levin to serve on Telluride Town Council

div.div: (November 8, 2023) â€“ On Tuesday, November 7, candidates Ashley Story and Elena Levin were elected to Telluride Town Council, each for four-year terms. According to the San Miguel County Clerk and Recorders Office, the Mayoral race is too close to call. Read on...

img.alt: Town Council Approves Increase of at least 50 percent to Business License Fees

h4.a: Town Council Approves Increase of at Least 50% to Business License Fees

div.div: (October 31, 2023) â€“ Town Council approved an increase of at least 50% to the Town of Telluride business license fees. Council began an evaluation of non-short-term rental business license fees in September, as the Town had not adjusted fees since 1996. Read on...

img.alt: Town Council Majority Passes New Short Term Rental Policy

h4.a: Town Council Majority Passes New Short-Term Rental Policy

div.div: (October 31, 2023) â€“ Town Council passed an ordinance amending the Telluride Municipal Code, decreasing short-term rental business license fees, implementing an admin fee and a regulatory fee, and adding licensing categories with different fee structures. Read on...

img.alt: Public Works Evaluating Tellurides Main Sewer Line

h4.a: Public Works Evaluating Tellurideâ€™s Main Sewer Line

div.div: (October 27, 2023) â€“ This week, the Town of Telluride Public Works Department and its contractor, Southwest Systems, are utilizing closed-circuit television (CCTV) to inspect the main sewer line from the Town to the Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant. Read on...

img.alt: Town Council Proclamation Recognizes Domestic Violence Awareness Month

h4.a: Town Council Proclamation Recognizes Domestic Violence Awareness Month

div.div: (October 24, 2023) â€“ Telluride Town Council and San Miguel Resource Center (SMRC) recognized October as Domestic Violence Awareness Month in a proclamation during todayâ€™s regular meeting of Town Council. Read on...

img.alt: Temporary Winter Community Housing Program Full for 2023 2024 Season

h4.a: Temporary Winter Community Housing Program Full for 2023/2024 Season

div.div: (October 10, 2023) â€“ The TWCHP is full for the upcoming winter. After receiving dozens of inquiries for the nine spaces, staff determined that the most reasonable approach would be to offer the spaces to the individuals who had already lived there. Read on...

img.alt: House Bill Creates Retail Establishment Liquor Permit

h4.a: House Bill Creates Retail Establishment Liquor Permit

div.div: (October 9, 2023) â€“ On September 21, Council directed staff to provide insight into current business license fees and modeling for potential changes. Business license fees are expected to be increased during the Tuesday, October 24 Town Council meeting. Read on...

img.alt: Town Council to Discuss Increase in Business License Fees

h4.a: Town Council to Discuss Increase in Business License Fees

div.div: (October 9, 2023) â€“ On September 21, Council directed staff to provide insight into current business license fees and modeling for potential changes. Business license fees are expected to be increased during the Tuesday, October 24 Town Council meeting. Read on...

img.alt: Short-Term Rental Business License and Regulatory Fees Established

h4.a: Short-Term Rental Business License & Regulatory Fees Established

div.div: (October 5, 2023) â€“ Telluride Town Council passed the first reading of an ordinance amending the Telluride Municipal Code to establish categories, reduced business license fees, an administrative fee, and a regulatory fee for short-term rental licenses. Read on...

img.alt: Off-Season Paving Operations to Commence Throughout Town

h4.a: Off-Season Paving Operations to Commence Throughout Town

div.div: (October 3, 2023) â€“ The Town of Telluride will begin milling, patching, and paving operations on several streets throughout town on Thursday, October 5. Intermittent lane and road closures will occur throughout the week without limiting access to Town. Read on...

img.alt: Suspect in Road Rage Incident in Police Custody

h4.a: Suspect in Road Rage Incident in Police Custody

div.div: (September 21, 2023) â€“ Local law enforcement has taken Andrew Michael Kjelland into custody after he voluntarily turned himself in to the San Miguel County Sheriffâ€™s Office. Kjelland was the subject of an arrest warrant for menacing issued on Wednesday. Read on...

img.alt: Arrest Warrant Issued for Suspect in Road Rage Incident

h4.a: Arrest Warrant Issued for Suspect in Road Rage Incident

div.div: (September 21, 2023) â€“ The Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department has obtained a warrant for the arrest of the individual previously sought in connection with a road rage incident that occurred on the night of Tuesday, September 19. Read on...

img.alt: Search Continues for Individual in Possession of Weapon in the Town of Telluride

h4.a: Search Continues for Individual in Possession of Weapon in the Town of Telluride

div.div: (September 20, 2023) â€“ The Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department is actively searching for an individual believed to be in possession of a weapon. Local law enforcement has initiated a coordinated effort to locate and apprehend the suspect. Read on...

img.alt: Pacific Avenue to Be Closed Intermittently from Spruce to Willow

h4.a: Pacific Avenue to Be Closed Intermittently from Spruce to Willow

div.div: (September 18, 2023) â€“ The Town of Telluride and Shaw Construction will close Pacific Avenue from Spruce to Willow intermittently beginning today, Monday, September 18. Read on...

img.alt: CPW humanely euthanized Telluride bear suffering from intestinal blockage caused by trash

h4.a: CPW humanely euthanized Telluride bear suffering from intestinal blockage caused by trash

div.div: (September 13, 2023) â€“ Colorado Parks and Wildlife humanely euthanized a sick male black bear Saturday night in Telluride. The boar showed signs of infection and was suffering from a severe intestinal blockage caused by consumed human trash. Read on...

img.alt: Telluride Black Bear Awareness Week Kicks Off September 10

h4.a: Telluride Black Bear Awareness Week Kicks Off September 10

div.div: (September 8, 2023) â€“ The Town of Tellurideâ€™s Annual Black Bear Awareness Week will take place from Sunday, September 10 through Saturday, September 16. Read on...

img.alt: Water Line Issue Results in Mudslide on Telluride Ski Resort

h4.a: Water Line Issue Results in Mudslide on Telluride Ski Resort

div.div: (September 8, 2023) â€“ The Town of Telluride and Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department are aware of a Telluride Ski Resort water line break above Stumper near Lift 7. The line break occurred around 10:30 pm last night, Thursday, September 8. Read on...

img.alt: California Man Identified by San Miguel County Coroner

h4.a: California Man Identified by San Miguel County Coroner

div.div: (September 5, 2023) â€“ Early this morning, Tuesday, September 5, the Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department responded to the unattended death of an adult male near the San Miguel River. The decedent has been identified as 61-year-old Andrew Hignite of California. Read on...

img.alt: Telluride Marshals Respond to Unattended Death

h4.a: Telluride Marshals Respond to Unattended Death

div.div: (September 5, 2023) â€“ This morning, the Telluride Marshalâ€™s Department responded to a death near the San Miguel River in Telluride. The death is currently under investigation, though no foul play is suspected. The family has been notified at this time. Read on...

img.alt: Town of Telluride Certifies Third Candidate for Mayor

h4.a: Town of Telluride Certifies Third Candidate for Mayor

div.div: (September 1, 2023) â€“ The Town of Telluride Clerkâ€™s Department has certified one additional candidate for the position of Mayor as of today, Friday, September 1, after their petition was cured and certified before the deadline of 5 pm MST. Read on...

h4.a: ParkMobile

div.div: The Town of Telluride is installing the new PARKMOBILE APPLICATION to better serve our residents and visitors with paying for parking through this new and improved app. Read on...

img.alt: civicready pic for newsflash

h4.a: CivicReady/IPAWS Mass Notification Solution

div.div: Town of Telluride Implements CivicReady Mass Notification Solution Read on...

img.alt: Water Report

h4.a: Water Efficiency Plan 2020-2027

div.div: Please read our Water Efficiency Plan. Additional Info...
